title: why didnt gangplank get the same treatment as illaoi?
body:
making his barrels visible in bushes when you have vision of the bush.

not even targetable. i think that part went too far for illaoi aswell. just visible, so you can play around them a bit better and dont get 2/3 of your health taken by an invisible barrel explosion.

in both cases it would be enough to give them the red shadow of units in bushes that oracles elixir on the howling abyss gives you.

Illaoi is all about the ''come at me bro'', right?
She's gonna kick your ass when you try to duel her. 
Gangplank is the guy who makes you think you're gonna get a fair fight, but then he blows your ass up outa nowhere.

Oh, and Gangplank doesn't suddenly make his Barrels untargetable when he ults...

the fact that ranged champions can now easily remove those things from outside bushes was a gigantic nerf for her. for some reason shes the only one who gets this treatment.

you dont see heimer turrets from outside bushes until theyre attacking. he can sneak them in there and lure you into a trap just as gangplank can.

without them shes literally nothing.

if anything you just listed a reason why gp is still a functional champion without his barrels, and illaoi relies on her tentacles even more, since her heal is tied to having tentacles around instead of just pressing w.
It does mean that a ranged champion would only need to auto them once to get rid of them whereas Illaoi's could at least take a hit.

> [{quoted}](name=Votable Jester,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VGUWVigL,comment-id=0002000100010000000000000001,timestamp=2016-08-03T23:39:20.405+0000)

he relies on the hitpoint decay so he only has to q them once to get an explosion. its not a disadvantage for him and not an argument.

ranged champions can easily take tentacles out in a matter of 2 seconds by poking at them. its not harder for them to take out a tentacle than it is to destroy a barrel.

plus, if you read through the thread i said in both cases they dont need to be targetable. they went too far with allowing people to attack those tentacles without direct vision. going by riots own reasoning for the change, that wasnt even necessary.
And also she is not squishy

Again, Illaoi gets a bunch of tentacles when she ults.
Gangplank doesn't.

That would be insane tho.
imagine an ult addition named "air drop" or something that cost 1k (or less) and threw down a ton of one hit barrels when he ults.

if that were to happen then Gangplank would lose the ability to make picks at all. Also, Gangplank barrels are a one time thing. You blow them up, and then they are gone. Illaoi's tentacles can smack you more than once. It's the equivalent of saying Garen can't use his bush strats anymore to kill someone.

Gangplank's power comes from his barrels, not directly from the champion model.
https://media.giphy.com/media/1Z02vuppxP1Pa/giphy.gif

The issue isn't with the tentacles smacking you more than once, it's the first time. If you don't identify that bush as a threat after the first time you get smacked then that is on you, but it feels unfair to be laning against Illaoi and have full vision of her and the first bush in toplane yet she still hits you from an unexpected angle because there was a tentacle in the bush that you couldn't see.

I'd say that maybe a middle ground for this situation would be best? If a tentacle/barrel is placed into a bush that you have vision of (not necessarily inside of, just vision of the bush) then it should remain visible but not targetable. If you don't have vision at the time it was placed then it doesn't appear until you get vision inside the bush.

Gangplank and Illaoi can both still get picks, but they can't cheese you out of a bush unless they make sure that their setup efforts are **well** out of sight.

Edit: Keep in mind I don't think that Gangplank is necessarily problematic so if this change (nerf really) hurts him significantly then he should definitely be buffed, maybe given an extra barrel back.

Tbh neither of them should have had this happen, it was a common strategy for illaoi to put tentacles in bushes so when i'd get ganked i'd run back to a bush because i know there is a tentacle in there that they can't get to and that i can use to my advantage. Gangplank does the same thing it's just that he actually needs to be able to do that, he's extremely squishy and his laning phase is bad so being able to place things in a bush give him an extra edge.

If anything you should learn tendencies of certain champions and understand what they're doing. Illaoi placing tentacles in a bush is very common, same with gangplank and his barrels. 

Multi-Hits or not it's a valid strategy that the opponent should learn to play around.

PS: Chances are if you tried to fight an illaoi and she started running, she was going to kill you anyway, she just chose to run back to part of the lane that she had control over. That's literally how she's supposed to be played, i do it constantly and i don't really consider it cheese it's their fault for falling for my bait.
It's AP Shaco all over again. I feel like I'm back at early season 2.

im still not convinced the entire reasoning couldnt be applied to gangplank aswell. or heimerdinger who can place turrets inside bushes to set a trap.
Dont forget Zyra and her seeds...which can be turned into plant turrets that can do some damage.

Also why can he place a barrel in the middle of a chain and have it go off?

They don't even have a travel time so there's absolutely no indication that you're going to get hit. It removes all the counterplay they supposedly have.

In case you haven't noticed Gangplank can't just put barrels out in the open because any ranged champion can disable them from complete safety and screw him. If his barrels were visible in brush he would literally have only 3 abilities.
